AD.name: Search Endpoint URL
AD.description: OpenSearch base endpoint URL, should include everything up to (and not including) the '?'

AD.name: Response Timeout
AD.description: Number of seconds that the client will wait for a response before it times out. The default is 0 (wait indefinitely). 0 specifies that the client will wait indefinitely.

AD.name: Connection Timeout
AD.description: Number of seconds that the client will attempt to establish a connection before it times out. The default is 30 seconds. 0 specifies that the client will continue to attempt to open a connection indefinitely.

AD.name: Max Result Count
AD.description: The maximum number of records to return. If a client specifies a larger value that value will be overriden with this value. 0 or empty means no override.

AD.name: Hard Coded Query Parameters
AD.description: Comma separated query parameter and value pairs (e.g. format=atom,timeout=300000)

AD.name: Ping URL
AD.description: URL to check if the site is up or down. The Method drop down should also be set to GET or HEAD of this URL is provieded

AD.name: Ping Method
AD.description: The HTTP method that should be used when calling the 'Check Availablity URL' to check status

AD.name: Minimum Source Ping Interval
AD.description: The minimum time interval (in seconds) between source availability checks. Source status will be pulled from cache if the minimum time has not passed.

AD.name: Wrap Atom Content with XML Fragment
AD.description: Check the box if you want the atom content value to be wrapped with an xml-fragment tag. This must be done if the metadata value returned is not valid XML, for instance if it is Html and doesn't have asingle root element

Option.label: Only Wrap HTML and Text Content Values

AD.name: Metadata Link Relation
AD.description: The link relation to use to populate the Metacard.METADATA element (leave blank if link relation not used)

AD.name: Product Link Relation
AD.description: The link relation to use to point to the Product

AD.name: Thumbnail Link Relation
AD.description: The link relation to use to populate the Metacard.THUMBNAIL element (leave blank if link relation not used)

AD.name: Proxy Product URLs through Local Node
AD.description: Check the box if you want all product URLs to be returned as local URLs referencing the existing server. This should be checked if it is expected that the client would not be able to directly access URLs that are pointing to the remote data source (e.g. if there were firewalls inplace that would prohibit the access from the client machine web browser)

AD.name: os:searchTerms
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the os:searchTerms value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: os:count
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the os:count value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: os:startIndex
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the os:startIndex value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: Start Index Numbering
AD.description: The method to lookup the single metacard entry for ID searches

AD.name: time:start
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the time:start value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: time:end
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the time:end value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: geo:uid
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the geo:uid value which is used to uniquely identity an entry (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: geo:box
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the geo:box value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: geo:lat
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the geo:lat value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: geo:lon
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the geo:lon value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: geo:radius
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the geo:radius value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: geo:geometry
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the geo:geometry value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: sru:sortKeys
AD.description: HTTP Parameter to use for the sru:sortKeys value (empty means it's not supported)

AD.name: Result Cache Expires
AD.description: If the geo:uid parameter is not populated/supported, the results will be cached which will enable lookups by ID. This specifies the number of minutes before the results are removed from the cache

AD.name: Sort Mapping
AD.description: Mapping for this source that converts the metacard attribute to a sort type for the outgoing request. The mapping should be done by using <metacard attribute>:<cdr type> format.
